poem:
Title: "Exotic Strands on a Grey Tapestry"

On our green isle, parakeets reside,
Not frail stowaways, branches their ride.
No debates nor boats, in emerald coats,
On the winds of chance, they freely glide.

Reaction's spectrum: anger, acceptance, cheer,
In their vivid presence, the simple fear.
Yet in grey days, they colour our gaze,
Paradoxical parakeets, Britain's frontier.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Nevertheless, they are highly divisive, with the poll revealing that the colourful creatures prompt reactions from downright hostility, through grudging acceptance, to a warm". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
